problems.title: Find Users Over 30
problems.description: Retrieve all users who are older than 30 years.
problems.explanation: Simple WHERE clause with a comparison operator filters rows based on a single condition.

problems.title: Users from USA
problems.description: Get all users who are from the USA.
problems.explanation: Equality operator (=) checks for exact matches in the country column.

problems.title: Premium Users from Specific Countries
problems.description: Find premium users who are from either USA or UK.
problems.solution:
SELECT name, country, premium
FROM users
WHERE premium = true 
  AND country IN ('USA', 'UK');
problems.explanation: Combines AND for multiple conditions and IN operator for checking against multiple values efficiently.

problems.title: Recent Signups
problems.description: Find users who signed up in February 2024.
problems.explanation: BETWEEN provides an inclusive range for date filtering, making queries more readable.

problems.title: Complex User Segmentation
problems.description: Find users who are either (from USA/Canada and age 25-30) OR (from UK and premium), signed up after Feb 1, and name doesn't start with 'B'.
problems.solution:
SELECT 
    name,
    age,
    country,
    premium,
    signup_date
FROM users
WHERE 
    (
        (country IN ('USA', 'Canada') AND age BETWEEN 25 AND 30)
        OR
        (country = 'UK' AND premium = true)
    )
    AND signup_date >= '2024-02-01'
    AND name NOT LIKE 'B%';
problems.explanation: Complex nested conditions with parentheses control evaluation order. Combines multiple operators (IN, BETWEEN, AND, OR, NOT LIKE) to create precise user segments for ML training datasets.

problems.title: Data Quality Filter
problems.description: Create a clean dataset by filtering users with valid data: non-null email and age, realistic age range (0-120), valid country, name longer than 1 character, and signups after Jan 1, 2024.
problems.solution:
SELECT 
    name,
    age,
    email,
    country,
    signup_date
FROM users
WHERE 
    email IS NOT NULL
    AND age IS NOT NULL
    AND age > 0
    AND age < 120
    AND country IS NOT NULL
    AND LENGTH(name) > 1
    AND signup_date >= '2024-01-01';
problems.explanation: Comprehensive NULL handling and validation checks ensure data quality for ML training. Each condition filters out different types of data issues.
